definition: propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
variant of 帆[fan1]
to gallop/Taiwan pr. [fan2]/variant of 帆[fan1]
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: But the sledding won't be smooth.
sentences.chinese: 但事情的发展肯定不会是一帆风顺。

sentences.english: None of these changes will happen smoothly or easily.
sentences.chinese: 这些变化需要各方的共同奋斗，不可能一帆风顺。

sentences.english: It’s important to remember that no one can recover perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 记住没有人可以恢复得一帆风顺，这点很重要。

sentences.english: The path to Rusal's Hong Kong listing was far from smooth.
sentences.chinese: 联合铝业在香港上市之路远非一帆风顺。

sentences.english: No one has ever said that being a Christian will give you a smooth life.
sentences.chinese: 从来没有人说成为基督徒就从此一帆风顺，无风无浪。

sentences.english: However, the development of Kanji in Japan was by no means problem-free.
sentences.chinese: 然而，汉字在日本的发展并非一帆风顺。

sentences.english: The early phases of the plan worked magnificently.
sentences.chinese: 该计划的起步阶段一帆风顺。

sentences.english: The micro-level works almost too well.
sentences.chinese: 微观层面的似乎运作的太一帆风顺了。

sentences.english: But the effort was anything but smooth.
sentences.chinese: 但这种努力并非一帆风顺。

sentences.english: Her progress from local manageress to company director had not been smooth.
sentences.chinese: 她从本地女经理升为公司董事并非一帆风顺。

sentences.english: I know everying cannot Fun smooth at work all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我知道在工作当中并非总是一帆风顺的。
但这个转变并非一帆风顺。

sentences.english: The math test was not difficult. I sailed right through it.
sentences.chinese: 数学考试并不困难，我一帆风顺的就考完了。

sentences.english: Whatever path I took – it was smooth and successful.
sentences.chinese: 无论我走哪一条路，都是一帆风顺的。

sentences.english: Everything is going smoothly. luck, have a bright future. by ambition.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺靠运气，鹏程万里靠志气。

sentences.english: It's my belief that no business or career can be problem-free in the development phase.
sentences.chinese: 相信任何生意和事业，在发展过程总不会一帆风顺。

definition: everything is going smoothly/just as one wishes
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
twists and turns
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
happy/satisfactory
smoothly/as one expects
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
as one wants/according to one's wishes/ruyi scepter, a symbol of power and good fortune
good luck
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
undertaking/project/activity/(charitable, political or revolutionary) cause/publicly funded institution, enterprise or foundation/career/occupation/CL:個|个[ge4]
pleasant/agreeable
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
